Title: Growth Engineer
Description:
The role of a Growth Engineer at Canonical
Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of technology adoption, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We are looking for an experienced
Growth Engineer
to join our team and take ownership of our marketing technology stack, data architecture, and infrastructure. This role is critical for designing and scaling the systems that power marketing automation, lifecycle marketing, and data-driven growth initiatives.
The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, data, and the use of technology in marketing. You will thrive in an environment that emphasizes ownership, collaboration, learning, and a drive to continually improve. If you love to solve complex problems, get hands-on with cutting-edge tools, and build the automated systems that fuel a global business, we want to talk with you.
This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.
Location:
This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.
What your day will look like
Design, build, and maintain our core data infrastructure and martech stack to support marketing and sales goals.
Develop and optimize robust data pipelines, automations, and integrations between our CRM, marketing platforms, and data warehouse.
Architect and manage APIs for seamless system integration and data flow across the entire stack.
Collaborate with marketing, sales, and product teams to understand their needs and architect technical solutions.
Implement and champion software engineering best practices, including clean code, CI/CD, automated testing, and version control.
Explore and integrate cutting-edge tools to enhance our data capabilities and operational efficiency.
Support marketing team members with strategic expertise, setting up and monitoring automations
Build on automation and AI to improve lead management
Develop Canonical's martech stack to industry leading standard
What we are looking for in you?
System Design:
Expertise in system design, particularly in the data world, with a strong understanding of networking, proxies, and data ingress/egress patterns.
Cloud & Databases:
Proficiency with cloud data warehousing (e.g., BigQuery), relational databases (e.g., Postgres), and object stores (e.g., S3). Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and data stores like Redis is a plus.
API Architecture:
Deep knowledge of API architecture and design, with a primary focus on REST. Experience with GraphQL is beneficial.
Programming:
Senior-level knowledge of Python (OOP, APIs, asyncio, scientific libraries) and SQL (experience with tools like Trino and dbt is highly valued).
Web Technologies:
A solid understanding of web application backend-frontend processes. Working knowledge of JavaScript is required; experience with React is a nice-to-have.
Engineering Best Practices:
A commitment to writing clean, maintainable code, with experience in CI/CD, automated testing, and version control (Git).
Mindset:
A curious and collaborative problem-solver with a growth mindset and a keen interest in the commercial domains of marketing and sales. Plus, exceptional interpersonal skills and aptitude for forging trusting relationships across diverse, cross-functional teams
What we offer you
Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.
🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
💰Annual compensation review
🏆Recognition rewards
🏝 Annual holiday leave
👶Parental Leave
🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme
🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
About Canonical
Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:
Company Description
Xtron is a cutting-edge cryptocurrency platform aimed at simplifying peer-to-peer exchanges and digital financial services in emerging markets. With a mission to make decentralized finance (DeFi) more accessible and secure, Xtron empowers users through a scalable and user-friendly mobile app for managing digital assets.
Role Description
We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack Developer to join our growing team and help build, maintain, and scale our crypto exchange platform. The ideal candidate will have strong experience working with PHP-based backend systems, React Native with TypeScript on the frontend. You will be expected to write clean, testable code, actively perform unit testing during development, and strictly adhere to our company’s technical SOPs
Key Responsibilities
Develop, maintain, and optimize backend services using PHP
Build and enhance mobile frontend features using React Native (TypeScript)
Collaborate with backend and frontend systems using Node.js where required
Design and consume RESTful and/or GraphQL APIs
Implement secure, scalable, and high-performance features for a crypto exchange platform
Write unit tests during development to ensure code reliability and maintainability
Participate in code reviews and follow established technical SOPs and coding standards
Deploy and manage applications using AWS CI/CD pipelines
Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve production issues efficiently
Work closely with product managers and designers to translate requirements into technical solutions
Key Responsibilities
Required Tech Skills
Develop, maintain, and optimize backend services using PHP
Build and enhance mobile frontend features using React Native (TypeScript)
Collaborate with backend and frontend systems using Node.js where required
Design and consume RESTful and/or GraphQL APIs
Implement secure, scalable, and high-performance features for a crypto exchange platform
Write unit tests during development to ensure code reliability and maintainability
Participate in code reviews and follow established technical SOPs and coding standards
Deploy and manage applications using AWS CI/CD pipelines
Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve production issues efficiently
Work closely with product managers and designers to translate requirements into technical solutions
Additional Qualifications (Nice to Have)
Prior experience working on crypto exchanges, fintech, or blockchain-related platforms
Knowledge of application security best practices
Experience with database systems (MySQL, PostgreSQL, or similar)
Understanding of scalability, performance optimization, and system architecture
Familiarity with Agile or Scrum development methodologies
Soft Skills & Expectations
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment
Excellent communication skills
High attention to detail and commitment to code quality
Willingness to strictly follow company technical SOPs and workflows
Availability to work 12:00 PM – 7:30 PM Nigerian Time consistently
What We Offer
Opportunity to work on a fast-growing crypto exchange platform
Collaborative and technically driven team environment
Competitive compensation based on experience with basic salary of N450,000.
Long-term growth and learning opportunities
If the above aligns with your skills and experience, you may be the right person we are looking for. Please send your resume and portfolio to admin@xtron.online or apply through LinkedIn.

Title: Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented
Blockchain Infrastructure Engineer
with deep expertise in
Fireblocks
platform and cryptocurrency ecosystems to join our growing team. This role will be instrumental in designing, implementing, and maintaining secure digital asset infrastructure that powers our blockchain operations.
The ideal candidate combines hands-on experience with Fireblocks API integration, cryptocurrency wallet management, and blockchain security protocols with a strong understanding of distributed systems and financial compliance requirements.
Key Responsibilities
Fireblocks Platform Management
Design, implement, and maintain Fireblocks infrastructure for secure digital asset custody, transfer, and settlement operations
Integrate Fireblocks API with existing systems and applications, ensuring seamless transaction workflows
Configure and manage Fireblocks workspace policies, transaction authorization rules, and multi-signature governance frameworks
Optimize Fireblocks vault architecture and implement best practices for key management and asset segregation
Cryptocurrency Operations
Build and maintain cryptocurrency wallet infrastructure across multiple blockchain networks (Bitcoin, Ethereum, EVM-compatible chains, etc.)
Implement automated workflows for digital asset deposits, withdrawals, and settlement processes
Monitor blockchain networks and transaction status, ensuring timely confirmations and resolution of stuck transactions
Manage gas optimization strategies and fee estimation algorithms for cost-effective transaction execution
Security & Compliance
Implement comprehensive security controls aligned with industry standards for digital asset custody
Establish audit logging, monitoring, and alerting systems for transaction anomaly detection
Collaborate with compliance and legal teams to ensure regulatory adherence (AML, KYC, travel rule compliance)
Conduct security assessments and vulnerability testing for blockchain-related infrastructure
Integration & Development
Develop APIs and microservices integrating Fireblocks with internal platforms and third-party services
Build automated reconciliation systems for blockchain transactions and internal ledgers
Create dashboards and reporting tools for real-time visibility into digital asset operations
Implement CI/CD pipelines for blockchain infrastructure deployment and configuration management
Collaboration & Documentation
Work cross-functionally with product, finance, and operations teams to translate business requirements into technical solutions
Create comprehensive technical documentation for Fireblocks configurations, workflows, and operational procedures
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to team members on blockchain technologies and best practices
Participate in incident response and troubleshooting for production blockchain systems
Required Qualification
Technical Skills
3+ years
of hands-on experience with
Fireblocks platform
(API integration, vault management, policy configuration)
Strong expertise in cryptocurrency protocols and blockchain networks (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Layer-2 solutions, etc.)
Proficiency in programming languages: Python, Node.js, TypeScript, or Go for blockchain application development
Experience with cryptocurrency wallet management, HD wallet derivation, and address generation
Knowledge of blockchain explorers, transaction monitoring, and on-chain analytics tools
Understanding of cryptographic primitives: digital signatures, hash functions, encryption schemes
Platform & Infrastructure
Experience with RESTful API design and integration with external blockchain services
Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) for deploying blockchain infrastructure
Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes for containerized application deployment
Knowledge of database systems (PostgreSQL, MongoDB) for transaction record management
Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions) for automated deployments
Blockchain Knowledge
Deep understanding of blockchain consensus mechanisms (PoW, PoS, BFT variants)
Knowledge of smart contract platforms (Ethereum, Solana, Polygon, Avalanche)
Familiarity with DeFi protocols and decentralized exchange integrations
Understanding of gas mechanics, transaction nonce management, and RBF/CPFP techniques
Awareness of blockchain security threats and mitigation strategies

Title: Contract Android OS Experience Design Engineer (Launcher + System UI Design System)
Description:
About the role
We’re building a new Android-based OS experience for a first-generation smartphone. The goal is a slick, premium, fast interface with a cohesive visual identity and a highly polished “system-level” feel across the home screen, app drawer, search, and assistant-style surfaces.
We need a Contract Android OS Experience Design Engineer to create a production-ready design system + UI pack that engineers can implement with minimal ambiguity. This is a hands-on role combining product design craft with implementation awareness (Android constraints, motion feasibility, asset formats, handoff discipline).
This is not “just pretty screens.” We need a structured pack: tokens, components, screens, iconography, motion specs, exports, and handoff docs.
Contract type
Contract / Freelance
Duration: 2–6 weeks (scope-dependent)
Location: Remote (West Africa time zone overlap preferred, but not required)
Start: ASAP
What you will own (core deliverables)1) OS Design System (Tokenized, production-ready)
Define and deliver a cohesive design system including:
Color tokens: brand palette + semantic tokens (primary, secondary, surface, background, error, success, warning, outline, elevation)
Light/Dark themes: full token sets with accessibility/contrast checks
Typography scale: font family selection + sizes + weights + line heights + letter spacing
Spacing system: 4/8dp grid rules, layout margins, component padding standards
Corner radius + elevation/shadows: standard radii and elevation guidelines
Interaction states: pressed/focus/disabled/loading states
Accessibility guidance: tap targets, font scaling, contrast recommendations
Output requirements
Figma tokens clearly labeled and structured
Optional token export (JSON) if using a token plugin
2) Launcher UI (Home + App Drawer + Search)
Create a complete UI/UX spec for:
Home screen
wallpaper behavior, widget placement, dock style
folders (visual treatment + open/close behavior)
long-press actions
App drawer
layout, search, sorting/filter patterns (if any)
empty state, loading state, “no results”
Global search
suggestions, recent actions, result types (apps/settings/contacts)
Edit mode
icon rearrange, add widget, change wallpaper, theme selection
Quick actions
contextual actions from app icons (shortcuts)
Must include
Visual specs + spacing + states
Key flows (user journeys) in Figma
Engineer-facing annotations (what’s static vs dynamic)
3) Assistant-Style Surface (Left Swipe Panel / Feed)
Design a system-level feed/panel surface that feels native:
Daily brief card (calendar/tasks)
Summaries (messages/calendar highlights)
Quick actions (reminders, notes, call, navigation, utilities)
Voice entry + text entry
Loading/empty/error states
Must include
Content layout rules
Card system rules (spacing, elevation, radius)
Interaction behaviors per card type
4) Visual Identity Assets (Icons, Wallpapers, UI Graphics)
Deliver:
App icon system
OS app icon + key system app icons style
Adaptive icon style rules (foreground/background layers)
System icons set
minimum 30–50 icons for v1 (settings, toggles, quick actions)
Wallpapers
5–10 premium wallpapers
Optional subtle graphic motifs/patterns used across the OS
File outputs
Icons: SVG source + export-ready assets
Wallpapers: WebP (preferred) + PNG if needed
App icons: adaptive-ready files + guidelines
5) Motion & Transitions Spec (Premium “Feel”)
Define motion language that makes the OS feel fast and expensive:
Motion principles (snappy vs smooth vs elastic)
Durations (ms) for core transitions
Easing curves recommendations
Motion staging (delays, stagger rules)
Key transitions storyboarded:
app open/close
home ↔ app drawer
panel slide
card expand/collapse
folder open/close
search open/close
Deliverables
Motion spec sheet (Figma + short written doc)
Optional Lottie JSON for specific in-app animations (only where appropriate)
6) Engineering Handoff Package
Provide clean handoff so implementation is fast:
A short Handoff Doc (PDF/Notion/Google Doc) covering:
token reference
component behaviors
do/don’t rules
states and edge cases
Export folder containing:
wallpapers
icons (SVG + exports)
font files (with license note)
Required skills & experience
3+ years in Product Design / UI/UX (mobile)
Strong experience building design systems (tokens + components + patterns)
Strong visual craft: typography, spacing, hierarchy, polish
Comfort designing for Android constraints (status bar, navigation patterns, touch targets)
Proficiency in Figma (components, variants, auto-layout, libraries)
Strong iconography skills (grid, strokes, optical alignment)
Solid motion fundamentals for UI interactions
“Design Engineer” expectations (implementation-awareness)
You do not need to be a full software engineer, but you must:
design with reusable components and token discipline (not one-off screens)
understand what is expensive/hard on Android (heavy blur, complex shader effects, excessive unique UI)
communicate behaviors precisely (states, transitions, edge cases)
collaborate with engineers and iterate based on feasibility feedback
Bonus (nice to have)
Familiarity with Material 3 concepts (without being constrained by them)
Experience with launchers, system UI, or motion-heavy products
Basic familiarity with Android resource formats (colors.xml, fonts, vector assets)
What success looks like
At the end of the contract:
We have a complete, cohesive OS design system
Engineers can implement launcher + assistant panel with minimal guessing
UI works beautifully in light + dark mode
Motion specs feel premium and are feasible to build
Assets are delivered in correct formats, organized cleanly
Apply Here:
https://jobs.usejuno.io/clive-hardware-bgehu/jobs/69469e29e6b3123bb70138f3

Title: Shift Supervisor
Description:
Wärtsilä is leading the transition towards a 100% renewable energy future. We Wärtsilians help our customers unlock the value of energy transition by optimizing their energy systems and future-proofing their assets. Did you know Wärtsilä has delivered 74 GW of power plant capacity and more than 80 energy storage systems in 180 countries around the world?
In this fast-changing world of energy, we are constantly on the lookout for future-oriented talent to join our team and to work towards enabling sustainable societies through innovation in technology and services - together. Want to join the ride?
We are currently seeking
Senegalese nationals
to join our team as
Shift Supervisors
at our Bel Air C6 site in
Dakar, Senegal.
In this role, you will be responsible for coordinating and overseeing shift operations, ensuring optimal performance while maintaining strict adherence to safety and quality standards.
Are you ready to be part of this exciting journey?
Your main responsibilities will include:
Your work will focus on these main responsibilities:
Supervise shift operations, coordinate, instruct and schedule work of operators and coordinate tasks and resources to meet production targets and deadlines.
Lead operational shift teams and provide training, guidance and support to team members, fostering a collaborative and safe work environment.
Direct all personnel actions.
Ensure that all team members receive required instructions in safety procedures, proper use of equipment, performance standards, disciplinary processes, and other workplace and company policies, procedures and practices.
Monitor operational performance and implement improvements to enhance efficiency and quality.
Oversee and ensure all work is completed in compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations, and company guidelines, processes and policies.
Manage the availability of tools, parts, and resources required for maintenance and operational tasks.
Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders to coordinate activities, resolve issues and continuously improve processes.
Education & experience:
Higher National Diploma(HND) or Degree in Engineering(B.Eng) or Technology (B.Tech) in Electrical/Mechanical/Electromechanical
5 years of relevant work experience in power plant operations
Handson working experience in any Wartsila engines
Proficiency in English & French language.
Skills & Competencies:
Communication Skills
Cost awareness & effectiveness
Teamwork skills
Wärtsilä Quality, safety, environment skills
Workplace ICT equipment & application skills
Why you and us:
We at Wärtsilä believe in empowerment, ownership and taking responsibility of our work. We support each other’s growth and co-creation is the true basis of our innovation. We have courage to see opportunities and take initiative. We are authentic and honest, and we strongly believe in a diverse and inclusive work community where everyone can be their true self. We don’t always get it right the first time, and if mistakes are made, we make sure to learn and grow from them. We want everyone to voice their opinions freely. That is why we have built an environment that empowers you and everyone around you, and where you can feel safe and cared for.
Are you eager to be part of this ambition?
How to apply:
Contact & next steps
Submit your application before the deadline through our Careers portal. Applications through email will not be considered. After submitting your application you’ll receive a confirmation email. We try our best to get back to everyone within 2-3 weeks after application deadline.
In case of any questions, reach out our Regional Talent Acquisition Team at careers@wartsila.com
Last application date: 02/12/2025
At Wärtsilä we value, respect and embrace all our differences, and are committed to diversity, inclusion and equal employment opportunities; everyone can be their true self and succeed based on their job-relevant merits and abilities.
Please note that according to Wärtsilä policy, voluntary consent for a security check may be required from candidates being considered for this position, depending on the applicable country.
This is Wärtsilä
Wärtsilä is a global leader in innovative technologies and lifecycle solutions for the marine and energy markets. We emphasise innovation in sustainable technology and services to help our customers continuously improve their environmental and economic performance. Our dedicated and passionate team of 17,000 professionals in more than 200 locations in 68 countries shape the decarbonisation transformation of our industries across the globe. In 2021, Wärtsilä’s net sales totalled EUR 4.8 billion. Wärtsilä is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. Find out more at www.wartsila.com.

Title: Legal Counsel
Description:
Part B: Responsibilities and Duties
• Engage with government officials and industry associations to form strategic partnerships, advocate for favourable policies and regulatory outcomes.
• Monitor legislative and regulatory developments relevant to the company’s business interests.
• Develop and maintain relationships with external stakeholders, including community groups, NGOs, and advocacy organizations.
• Apply for governmental approvals including but not limited to licenses, permits and authorizations etc.
• Provide legal support for stakeholder engagement initiatives and corporate social responsibility programs.
• Provide legal guidance on public relations strategies, media relations, and corporate communications.
• Ensure compliance with legal and ethical standards in all external affairs activities.
• Provide accurate and timely counsel to corporate management team in a variety of legal related matters.
• Collaborating with management to devise efficient defence strategies, apply effective risk management techniques and offer proactive advises on possible legal issues and evaluate different risk factors.
• Draft and solidify agreements, contracts, and other legal documents to ensure the company’s full legal rights
• Provide clarification on legal language or specifications to the board, HODs, management internally
• Perform cross-functionally / organization to manage different projects and execution of new initiatives.
• Identify risks along with propose alternative structures to reduce risks involved in prospective transactions.
• Resolves legal matters including managing disputes with third party, litigation, and government enforcement actions
• AD-HOC tasked by immediate superior / assigned by senior management
Part C: Qualifications & Requirements (Education, Experience, Skills, Knowledge, Etc)
• Completed a Bachelor of Law (LLB) undergraduate degree or a Juris Doctor (JD) postgraduate degree in Senegal/Mauritania
• Minimum 8 years of experience practicing law in Senegal/Mauritania, with a focus on external affairs, public relations, or government relations
• A strong preference for candidates with palm plantation industry exposure
• Strong knowledge of relevant legal and regulatory frameworks, including communications law, lobbying regulations and political compliance
• Adaptable and a versatile mindset, comfortable working in stressful and fast-paced environment
• A hands-on go getter who is commercially savvy
• Preferably proven experience / records as a legal counsel in business environment
Part D: Others (if any)
• Working Location: Senegal
• 5 working days week
• Remuneration commensurate with relevant working experience and trade knowledge (palm plantation industry)
• Requires occasional travel

Chez Marriott International, nous nous engageons à promouvoir l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi, à accueillir dignement chaque personne et à offrir les mêmes opportunités à tous. Nous avons instauré un environnement dans lequel les particularités de nos collaborateurs sont appréciées et célébrées. Notre plus grande force réside dans le mélange varié de cultures, de compétences et d’expériences de nos collaborateurs. Nous veillons à prévenir toute discrimination fondée sur des critères protégés, notamment le handicap, le statut de vétéran et tout autre aspect couvert par la loi en vigueur.
Là où les classiques intemporels s'unissent aux détails modernes. Là où affaires riment avec plaisir. Et là où même les voyageurs et voyageuses du monde entier peuvent découvrir les spécificités locales. En tant que membre de l'équipe, vous ferez partie de notre communauté Four Points by Sheraton, une communauté soudée où tout le monde est le bienvenu, où nous nous soutenons tous et toutes et où chaque hôtel compte. Nous offrons exactement ce dont la clientèle recherche, simplement et sans complications inutiles. Si vous cherchez à pouvoir accueillir et mettre à l'aise votre clientèle dans un environnement chaleureux, authentique et accessible, intégrez notre équipe. En rejoignant Four Points, vous intégrerez le portefeuille d'enseignes de Marriott International.
Rejoignez
une entreprise qui vous donne la possibilité de donner le meilleur de vous-même, de
trouver
un sens à votre vie professionnelle, de
faire partie
d'une équipe internationale d'exception et de
devenir
la meilleure version de vous-même.

Title: Executive Chef I
Description:
Additional Information
Job Number
25195188
Job Category
Food and Beverage & Culinary
Location
Four Points by Sheraton Dakar Diamniadio, Diamniadio Sports City, Dakar, Senegal, Senegal,VIEW ON MAP
Schedule
Full Time
Located Remotely?
N
Position Type
Management
Job Summary
Accountable for overall success of the daily kitchen operations. Exhibits culinary talents by personally performing tasks while leading the staff and managing all food related functions. Works to continually improve guest and employee satisfaction while maximizing the financial performance in all areas of responsibility. Supervises all kitchen areas to ensure a consistent, high quality product is produced. Responsible for guiding and developing staff including direct reports. Must ensure sanitation and food standards are achieved. Areas of responsibility comprise overseeing all food preparation areas (e.g., banquets, room service, restaurants, bar/lounge and employee cafeteria) and all support areas (e.g., dish room and purchasing).
CANDIDATE PROFILE
Education And Experience
High school diploma or GED; 6 years experience in the culinary, food and beverage, or related professional area.
OR
2-year degree from an accredited university in Culinary Arts, Hotel and Restaurant Management, or related major; 4 years experience in the culinary, food and beverage, or related professional area.
CORE WORK ACTIVITIES
Leading Kitchen Operations for Property
Leads kitchen management team.
Provides direction for all day-to-day operations.
Understands employee positions well enough to perform duties in employees' absence or determine appropriate replacement to fill gaps.
Provides guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.
Utilizes interpersonal and communication skills to lead, influence, and encourage others; advocates sound financial/business decision making; demonstrates honesty/integrity; leads by example.
Encourages and builds mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.
Serving as a role model to demonstrate appropriate behaviors.
Ensures property policies are administered fairly and consistently.
Reviews staffing levels to ensure that guest service, operational needs and financial objectives are met.
Establishes and maintains open, collaborative relationships with employees and ensures employees do the same within the team.
Solicits employee feedback, utilizes an "open door" policy and reviews employee satisfaction results to identify and address employee problems or concerns.
Supervises and coordinates activities of cooks and workers engaged in food preparation.
Demonstrate new cooking techniques and equipment to staff.
Setting and Maintaining Goals for Culinary Function and Activities
Develops and implements guidelines and control procedures for purchasing and receiving areas.
Establishes goals including performance goals, budget goals, team goals, etc.
Communicates the importance of safety procedures, detailing procedure codes, ensuring employee understanding of safety codes, monitoring processes and procedures related to safety.
Manages department controllable expenses including food cost, supplies, uniforms and equipment.
Participates in the budgeting process for areas of responsibility.
Knows and implements the brand's safety standards.
Ensuring Culinary Standards And Responsibilities Are Met
Provides direction for menu development.
Monitors the quality of raw and cooked food products to ensure that standards are met.
Determines how food should be presented, and create decorative food displays.
Recognizes superior quality products, presentations and flavor.
Ensures compliance with food handling and sanitation standards.
Follows proper handling and right temperature of all food products.
Ensures employees maintain required food handling and sanitation certifications.
Maintains purchasing, receiving and food storage standards.
Prepares and cooks foods of all types, either on a regular basis or for special guests or functions.
Ensuring Exceptional Customer Service
Provides and supports service behaviors that are above and beyond for customer satisfaction and retention.
Improves service by communicating and assisting individuals to understand guest needs, providing guidance, feedback, and individual coaching when needed.
Manages day-to-day operations, ensuring the quality, standards and meeting the expectations of the customers on a daily basis.
Displays leadership in guest hospitality, exemplifies excellent customer service and creates a positive atmosphere for guest relations.
Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels.
Responds to and handles guest problems and complaints.
Empowers employees to provide excellent customer service. Establishes guidelines so employees understand expectations and parameters. Ensures employees receive on-going training to understand guest expectations.
Reviews comment cards, guest satisfaction results and other data to identify areas of improvement.
Managing and Conducting Human Resource Activities
Identifies the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.
Ensures employees are treated fairly and equitably.
Trains kitchen associates on the fundamentals of good cooking and excellent plate presentations.
Administers the performance appraisal process for direct report managers.
Interacts with the Banquet Chef and Catering department on training regarding food knowledge and menu composition.
Observes service behaviors of employees and provides feedback to individuals and or managers.
Manages employee progressive discipline procedures for areas of responsibility.
Ensures disciplinary procedures and documentation are completed according to Standard and Local Operating Procedures (SOPs and LSOPs) and supports the Peer Review Process.
Additional Responsibilities
Provides information to executive teams, managers and supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.
Analyzes information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.
At Marriott International, we are dedicated to being an equal opportunity employer, welcoming all and providing access to opportunity. We actively foster an environment where the unique backgrounds of our associates are valued and celebrated. Our greatest strength lies in the rich blend of culture, talent, and experiences of our associates. We are committed to non-discrimination on any protected basis, including disability, veteran status, or other basis protected by applicable law.
Where timeless classics are woven with modern details. Where business meets pleasure. Where even when travelers are global, they can experience the local. As a member of the team, you will become part of our united Four Points by Sheraton community where everyone is welcome, we support each other, and every hotel matters. We provide exactly what guests need in an uncomplicated way. If you are seeking opportunities to put guests at ease in a friendly, genuine and approachable environment, join our team. In joining Four Points, you join a portfolio of brands with Marriott International.
Be
where you can do your best work,
begin
your purpose,
belong
to an amazing global team, and
become
the best version of you.

Title: Diseñador Gráfico y Producción Multimedia
Description:
Responsabilidades Principales
Conceptualización y Diseño: Desarrollar ideas visuales y producir gráficos para diversos medios (digitales e impresos).
Creación de Activos: Diseñar logotipos, ilustraciones, infografías, banners, publicaciones para redes sociales, maquetas web, empaques, etc..
Colaboración: Trabajar con equipos de marketing, desarrollo o clientes para entender requisitos y alinear diseños con la marca.
Manejo de Software: Dominio de herramientas como la Suite Adobe (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) y/o plataformas como Canva.
Alineación de Marca: Asegurar que todos los diseños sigan la identidad visual y los mensajes de la empresa.

Title: Digital Sales Manager
Description:
Do you want to be a part of a successful team?
Do you like working in collaborative teams and solving critical issues?
Be part of a successful team
As a leader in the oilfield services & equipment industry, Baker Hughes offers opportunities for qualified people who want to grow in our high-performance organization. Our leading technologies and our ability to apply them safety and effectively create value for our customers and shareholders.
Partner with the best
You will be developing, owning and executing a strategic sales account plans to drive digital product and service revenue growth across Region and Product Segment.
You Will Be Responsible For
Developing, owning and executing a strategic sales account plans to drive digital product and service revenue growth across Region and Product Segment.
Engaging with ‘C’ level and key customer personas to promote the Digital Well Construction portfolio.
Being a Trusted Advisor and Customer Champion, establishing partnership relationships with key clients.
Introducing technical sales representative and sales support teams for deep technical dives and understanding of the solutions.
Leading efforts to establish and expand market share, own pipeline planning, creation and maintenance.
Collaborate with product development, engineering, marketing, and sales teams to align digital offerings with market demands and communicate value propositions effectively
Working with leaders across the organization to develop growth strategies across product offerings with complex and enterprise customers.
Fuel your passion
To be successful in this role you will need to:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college and 3+yrs of experience with Software/SaaS Account Sales.
Possess knowledge of Well Construction, Drilling, Remote Monitoring, or Performance Optimization
Possess knowledge of financial, competitor, upstream environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Excellent interpersonal and leadership skills.
Ability to influence others and lead small teams.
Lead initiatives of moderate scope and impact.
Ability to coordinate several projects simultaneously.
Effective problem identification and solution skills.
Proven analytical and organizational ability.
Work in a way that works for you
We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, you will have to be based in Luanda, Angola but will have to travel to all our Centers of Excellence and Technology from time to time.
Working with us
Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other.
Working for you
Our Inventions Have Revolutionized Energy For Over a Century. But To Keep Going Forward Tomorrow, We Know We Have To Push The Boundaries Today. We Prioritize Rewarding Those Who Embrace Change With a Package That Reflects How Much We Value Their Input. Join Us, And You Can Expect
Contemporary work-life balance policies and wellbeing activities
Comprehensive private medical care options
Safety net of life insurance and disability programs
Tailored financial programs
Additional elected or voluntary benefits
About Us
We are an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial customers worldwide. Built on a century of experience and conducting business in over 120 countries, our innovative technologies and services are taking energy forward – making it safer, cleaner and more efficient for people and the planet.
Join Us
Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company that values innovation and progress? Join us and become part of a team of people who will challenge and inspire you! Let’s come together and take energy forward.
Baker Hughes Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: BRAND ASSISTANT (Researches & Studies)
Location: Communauté urbaine de Douala, Littoral, Cameroon
Description:
Société
Filiale du Groupe Holcim, Cimencam est le leader des matériaux de la construction au Cameroun et en Afrique centrale. Cimencam, c’est une équipe de plusieurs centaines d’hommes et femmes motivés et de plus en plus compétents.
L’entreprise a une présence équilibrée sur le territoire national avec une station de broyage et une usine à mortiers à Bonabéri dans le Littoral, une station de broyage à Nomayos dans le centre, une filiale à Figuil dans le Nord (Cimencam Figuil), qui est une cimenterie intégrée.
Fonction
MISSION
Dans le respect des règles santé, sécurité & de l’environnement, le brand Assistant (Reseasch & Studies) assiste les membres de la direction marketing (directeur et collaborateurs) en organisant leurs événements et déplacements, en participant aux différents projets, mais également en rédigeant les catalogues produits et de supports d’aide à la vente.
PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITES
Se charger des tâches administratives quotidiennes pour assurer la fonctionnalité et la coordination des activités du département ;
Soutenir la responsable marketing dans l’organisation de divers projets ;
Conduire des études de marché et analyser les rapports d’évaluation des clients/les questionnaires ;
Utiliser les techniques d’analyse de marketing pour collecter des données importantes (médias sociaux, analytiques du web, classements, etc.) ;
Aider à l’organisation d’événements promotionnels et de campagnes traditionnelles ou numériques, et y assister pour en faciliter le succès ;
Rédiger la documentation de marketing (brochures, articles de presse, etc.) pour renforcer la présence de la société sur le marché ;
Compiler et distribuer des informations financières et statiques telles que les feuilles de calcul budgétaires, les bases de données et les inventaires ;
Suivre régulièrement les des commandes et les livraisons ;
Organiser les présentations et des visites à la clientèle ;
Évaluer les résultats des différentes campagnes de marketing.
Profil
Qualifications Et Competences Requises
Bac+ 3/4 ecole de commerce avec spécialité Marketing et/ou communication.
Expérience professionnelle : Minimum 2 ans dans une fonction similaire
Français et Anglais
COMPETENCES TECHNIQUES
Bonne compréhension des principes de la gestion de bureau et du marketing
Bonne connaissance des techniques d’étude de marché et des bases de données
Excellente connaissance de MS Office, d’un logiciel informatique de marketing et des applications en ligne (outils de CRM, analytiques en ligne, Google Adwords, etc.)
Bonne maîtrise des chiffres et dans leur manipulation.
Avoir des connaissances en matière de techniques d’utilisation du matériel bureautique
COMPETENCES COMPORTEMENTALES
Exceptionnelles compétences de communication et relationnelles
Avoir de bonnes aptitudes en gestion de projet (animation de réunion, planification de l’activité, suivi de projet)
Forte capacité d’autonomie et organisationnelle
Esprit d’équipe
Rigoureux, dynamique, créatif
Sens de responsabilité et forte intégrité
Langues
Anglais et Français

Title: Senior Field Sales
Location: Communauté urbaine de Douala, Littoral, Cameroon
Description:
Société
Filiale du Groupe Holcim, Cimencam est le leader des matériaux de la construction au Cameroun et en Afrique centrale. Cimencam, c’est une équipe de plusieurs centaines d’hommes et femmes motivés et de plus en plus compétents.
L’entreprise a une présence équilibrée sur le territoire national avec une station de broyage et une usine à mortiers à Bonabéri dans le Littoral, une station de broyage à Nomayos dans le centre, une filiale à Figuil dans le Nord (Cimencam Figuil), qui est une cimenterie intégrée.
Fonction
MISSION
Dans le respect des règles de santé & sécurité & de l’environnement et les valeurs CRISP du groupe Holcim, le Senior Field Sales a pour objectifs de réaliser les objectifs de volume, de part de marché, de vitesse de rotation des produits dans le secteur placé sous sa responsabilité.
PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITES
Elaborer des plans d’actions territoire et clients
Assurer un standard élevé des vecteurs de vente
Assurer un meilleur ciblage et couverture des PDV qui facilite le retour sur investissement (Clients/segments prioritaires),
Veiller à la livraison immédiatement les clients en rupture de stocks
Battre la concurrence par un monitoring effectif des activités, prise des actions de contre attaque, Reporting ;
Veiller à la réalisation des objectifs de visite client à travers un plan de tournée efficient,
Elaborer une cartographie de l’univers clients (revendeurs, fabricants et chantiers de ménages)
Identifier les opportunités et élaborer des plans d’action pour les segments cibles ;
Assurer les conseils et l’orientation à la clientèle ;
Recueillir et transmettre les réclamations clients au service client ;
Assurer le recouvrement des créances clients
Développer le portefeuille clients de son secteur (revendeurs, fabricants et chantiers de ménages)
Rédiger et diffuser des rapports d’activités
Profil
Qualifications Et Competences Requises
Un Bac+3 en Action Commerciale
Moins de 5 années d’expérience dans les fonctions de ventes/Marketing/Service client
Un permis de conduire de cat B valide
COMPETENCES TECHNIQUES
Connaissance des règles de Santé, Sécurité, Sûreté et environnement
Maîtrise des techniques de planification de la tournée commerciale
Connaissances des techniques de vente de base
Maîtrise de la catégorisation et gestion portefeuille clients
Utilisation du CRM
Approche basique des marques/marchés et concurrence
Utilisation de l’outil informatique (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
COMPETENCES COMPORTEMENTALES
Rigueur et précision
Capacité d’analyse et de prise de décision
Intégrité
Proactivité
Disponibilité, pédagogie et diplomatie
Travail d’équipe
Langues
Anglais et Français

Title: ASSISTANT FINANCIER ET ADMINISTRATIF
Description:
Titre du poste: Assistant Financier Et Administratif
Location: Garoua, Cameroun
Exigence en matière de déplacements : moins de 10% du temps
Qui Sommes-nous?
Populations Services International (PSI) est un réseau d’organisations locales et connectées à l’échelle mondiale qui s’efforcent de mettre en place des soins de santé axés sur les consommateurs, centrés sur la personne et garantissant des soins de qualité et abordables partout et quand ils sont nécessaires. Nos origines dans la santé sexuelle et reproductive se sont transformées en une mission plus large. Aujourd’hui, nous travaillons avec les secteurs public et privé ainsi qu’avec les communautés locales, en donnant la priorité à la voix et au choix des gens et en développant des solutions pour répondre à leurs besoins essentiels en matière de santé.
Au cours des cinq dernières décennies, nous avons contribué à repousser les limites, à briser les tabous, à définir des tendances et à développer des solutions innovantes pour des défis complexes en matière de santé mondiale.
PSI est présent au Cameroun depuis plus de 30 ans, avec un portefeuille de projets et programmes axés sur le Paludisme, la santé reproductive, la survie de l’enfant et la prévention du VIH et de l’hépatite.
Rejoignez-nous!
PSI Réunit Et Mobilise Des Compétences Aussi Bien Au Niveau Local Que Mondial, Dans Le Respect De Son Code Éthique Et De Ses Valeurs, à Savoir
La Collaboration : Vous pouvez travailler de manière indépendante mais vous vous épanouissez au sein d'une équipe.
La Confiance : Vous savez que votre responsable et votre équipe vous soutiendront et vous tenez à gagner cette même confiance de vos coéquipiers.
Le Pragmatisme : Vous vous lancez et maintenez votre élan même lorsque les choses sont ambiguës et ne laissez pas la perfection prendre le pas sur le suffisant.
L’Honnêteté : Vous n'avez pas peur de vous exprimer et de dire ce que vous pensez.
La Mesure : Vous fixez des objectifs clairs et stimulants et vous vous tenez responsable de l'obtention de résultats mesurables.
L’Engagement : Vous êtes indépendant et libre penseur, mais vous êtes prêt à adhérer à la direction de l'équipe et à vous engager pour son succès.
Le nouveau membre est appelé à jouer un rôle crucial au sein de l’organisation en contribuant à la fluidité des opérations quotidiennes tout en assurant une gestion financière rigoureuse. Il doit combiner des compétences en gestion, en comptabilité et en logistique pour contribuer efficacement à la gestion des tâches quotidiennes et à la santé financière de l’organisation.
Que recherchons-nous?
Pour les besoins de mise en œuvre des interventions de la plateforme du Cameroun, PSI voudrait s’attacher les compétences d’un(e)
Assistant(e) Administratif(ve) et Financier.
Sous la supervision du
Directeur de projet du Programme d’Accès à la Santé de la Reproduction (PASSR),
Il/Elle assurera la gestion pratique des aspects administratifs, financiers et logistique en collaboration avec les services supports de PSI Cameroun. Il/Elle veille au bon suivi administratif et financier du projet.
Conditions de travail et autres informations clés sur le poste :
Poste: basé à Garoua
Niveau de Carrière : S3
Niveau de poste : Intermédiaire
Statut: Poste Local
Type de Contrat : CDD (2ans)
Date de prise de fonction : Avril 2025
Exigence en matière de déplacements : moins de 10% du temps
Rapporte au Responsable Programme
Le/La titulaire du poste sera placé(e) sur une grille salariale conforme aux normes de PSI Cameroun et bénéficiera des formations de renforcement des capacités dans la mesure où la plateforme le permet ;
Travail à distance : Autorisé
Votre contribution
Pour ce poste, le/la candidat(e) devra prouver, grâce à ses expériences précédentes, qu'il/elle peut accomplir efficacement les missions énoncées ci-dessous. Cette liste n'est pas exhaustive et résume les principales responsabilités et exigences. Le/La titulaire pourra aussi être chargé de tâches non mentionnées.
Apporter un Appui Administratif
Apporter un appui dans la gestion administrative du projet ;
Rédiger les correspondances administratives ;
Assurer la circulation des courriers officiels ;
Assurer l’encadrement technique des personnels du projet et leur apporter ressource et expertise dans les domaines de gestion administrative ;
Effectuer l’enregistrement et le classement des différents documents reçus ; Appuyer et suivre tous les achats du projet ;
Apporter un appui logistique à l’organisation des séminaires et ateliers du projet ;
Recevoir les demandes d’avance de voyage et les documents justificatifs des dépenses d’activités pour les soumettre à la signature ;
Assurer la circulation de l’information, communiquer avec les services de PSI et les partenaires extérieures ;
Assurer la logistique (réservation et voyage) ;
Assister aux réunions et élaborer les rapports et compte rendu ;
Apporter un appui dans la gestion des moyens généraux
Assurer la disponibilité des produits d’entretien et la gestion du petit stock de matériel de bureau ;
Suivre l’établissement et le renouvellement des documents administratifs relatifs au matériel roulant de l’organisation et/ou vérifier la mise à jour des documents administratifs pour le matériel loué auprès des tiers ;
Veiller au réapprovisionnement du carburant suivant les solutions en vigueur.
Apporter un Appui en matière de gestion des finances
Gérer les comptes fournisseurs et les comptes clients ;
Tenir un brouillard de banque et effectuer des rapprochements bancaires ;
Tenir à jour les dossiers financiers ;
Assurer la gestion de la petite caisse conformément aux procédures en vigueurs
Aider à l'élaboration du budget et des prévisions ;
Aider lors des audits ;
Assurer la remontée des pièces justificatives au siège dans les délais ;
Apporter l’appui nécessaire à l’élaboration des rapports financiers.
Education
Essentiel : Minimum (Bac+2) en Administration, logistique, Gestion, Comptabilité ou Finance.
Souhaité : Minimum (Bac+3) en Administration, logistique, Gestion, Comptabilité ou Finance.
Experience
Minimum deux (02) années d'expériences professionnelles (exigé) à un poste similaire de préférence dans un organisme pertinent ou dans une ONG internationale.
Compétences requises:
Planifier et organiser le travail
Maîtrise de nouvelles technologies
Avoir une maîtrise avérée du pack office ;
Avoir des notions en analyse des données ;
Ecrire et parler couramment en français ou en anglais ; la maitrise de l’autre langue fortement recommandée.
Qualités personnelles:
Développer et entretenir un environnement de travail basé sur le respect de la diversité
Pouvoir démontrer des compétences pour la gestion des relations humaines, la communication et le développement des individus ;
Avoir un sens de l’organisation
Faire preuve d’intégrité, d’honnêteté et d’une bonne moralité
Promouvoir et défendre les priorités de l’organisation
S’orienter vers les résultats et l’excellence
Avoir un esprit structuré et une bonne capacité d’expression orale et écrite ;
Avoir une disposition à travailler sous pression et à se remettre en cause ;
Constitution et dépôt du dossier de candidature :
Lettre de motivation;
Curriculum vitae détaillé;
Photocopies des diplômes exigés. Une vérification des Diplômes sera effectuée pour le candidat retenu ;
Les photocopies des documents qui justifient l’expérience du candidat, (contrats de travail, attestation d’emploi, certificat de travail, y relatif) ;
Trois références professionnelles n’ayant aucun lien de parenté avec le candidat (dont 2 des deux derniers employeurs).
Comment Postuler
Veuillez utiliser ce lien pour postuler à un emploi
Assistant Financier At Administratif
NB
: Seuls les dossiers des candidats autorisés à travailler au Cameroun seront pris en considération.
Notre politique d’emploi
PSI est un employeur équitable et encourage les candidatures de personnes qualifiées sans distinction de race, religion, couleur, sexe, âge, origine nationale, handicap, état matrimonial, immatriculation, appartenance politique, statut ou responsabilités familiales, identité ou, grossesse, accouchement, conditions médicales connexes ou allaitement maternel, information génétique, amnistie, ancien combattant, ancien combattant handicapé, statut de membre des forces armées ou de statut professionnel.
PSI est un employeur qui offre des chances égales d’emploi et encourage fortement les candidatures féminines.
Seuls les candidats présélectionnés seront contactés.
PSI se réserve le droit de recruter à un niveau inférieur ou sur la base d'un profil de poste modifié.
Des références sont requises et le candidat retenu devra se soumettre à une vérification des antécédents.
Le/La candidat(e) final sélectionné(e), devra soumettre un extrait de son casier judiciaire avant la prise effective de service.
PSI propose des échelles salariales variables pour ce poste, en fonction du diplôme, du nombre d’année d’expérience et des atouts du candidat.
Fait à Yaoundé le 12 février 2025
Le Représentant Pays
Daniel Christian KOKO
OFCCP24

Title: Junior Field Sales (Intérimaire)
Location: Communauté urbaine de Douala, Littoral, Cameroon
Description:

Title: Responsable juridique
Location: Communauté urbaine de Douala, Littoral, Cameroon
Description:
Contexte et environnement
Environnement légal et réglementaire évolutif
Difficile accès aux textes juridiques
Réduction du risque contentieux
Activités
Les principales missions de Responsable Juridique:
Négociation des contrats
Participation à la négociation des contrats;
Rédaction des conventions , contrats, accords et protocole d'accord;
Supervision à l'élaboration et à la mise en place des contrats
Conseils et assistance aux unités opérationnelles
Accompagnement juridique des équipes opérationnelles dans leurs activités
Assistance des entités de la filiales dans le respect de dispositions légales et réglementaires en vigueur;
Traitement de diverse réclamations pouvant avoir des implications juridiques et reçues des entités de la filiale.
Prévention des litiges
Sensibilisation des équipes opérationnelles sur les risques juridiques liés à leurs activités;
Recherche et proposition des fondements juridiques de la défense de l'entreprise en cas de réclamation;
Consultations juridiques auprès des Avocats le cas échéant;
Veille à la conformité légale de tous les accords, contrats et tous les actes de l'entreprise.
Gestion du précontentieux et du contentieux
Gestion des réclamations;
Participation à la protection juridique de l'entreprise en vue de prévenir le contentieux
Adresse des éléments de réponse aux diverses réclamations des tiers en relation avec les directions/départements/services concernés;
Gestion du contentieux;
Représentation de l'entreprise devant les Administrations.
Veille réglementaire
Entretien d'un réseau d'informations, de stratégies de collecte et de diffusion des textes législatifs et réglementaires;
Constitution d'une documentation juridique de l'entreprise;
Mise en place de la réglementation des dépôts conformément à la législation en vigueur et les normes de la Compagnie.
Recouvrement des créances
Proposition des stratégies de recouvrement des créances;
Suivi en binôme avec AJA du recouvrement amiable judiciaire
Profil du candidat
Master en Droit Privé/Droit des Affaires
Une expérience dans un cabinet d'avocat est un atout
Ténacité, esprit d'initiative et d'anticipation,
Rigueur, proactivité, méthode et organisation du travail
Bonne connaissance et respect des procédures liées à l'activité
Bonne maîtrise de l'outil informatique (reporting fiable)
Bonne aptitude à la rédaction des courriers et des rapports
Informations supplémentaires
Le candidat doit avoir de bonnes connaissances en droit des affaires
TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Non-Resident Fellow in Public Health / Health Policy
Description:
Non-Resident Fellows in Public Health / Health Policy
Nkafu Policy Institute – Denis & Lenora Foretia Foundation
Application Deadline: January 15, 2026
Fellowship Duration: 1 year, renewable by mutual agreement
Number of Positions:
Three (3) Non-Resident Fellows
Engagement Level: Part-time
Compensation: Monthly stipend provided
About the Nkafu Policy Institute
The Nkafu Policy Institute of the Denis & Lenora Foretia Foundation is a leading independent African policy research institution with vision to accelerate Africa's Economic Transformation. It drives Africa’s prosperity through evidence-informed policymaking, enabling all citizens to thrive in free, fair, democratic, and flourishing economies. Through rigorous analysis, high-impact publications, and inclusive dialogue, Nkafu promotes practical reforms that strengthen governance and enhance Africa’s development trajectory.
To expand its leadership in health systems research and policy analysis, the Institute is pleased to announce a Call for Applications for three (3) Non-Resident Fellows in Public Health or Health Policy.
About the Non-Resident Fellowship
The Nkafu Non-Resident Fellowship is a prestigious, part-time appointment designed for experienced senior professionals with a demonstrated track record in public health, health systems, or health policy research. Fellows remain based in their home institutions or countries of residence while contributing substantively to the Nkafu Policy Institute’s work.
Each Fellow will serve for a one-year renewable term, during which they will produce influential research, participate in high-level dialogues, and help shape the health policy landscape in Central Africa and the continent at large. Fellows will receive a monthly stipend to support their engagement.
Responsibilities of Non-Resident Fellows
Non Resident Fellows will play a strategic role in advancing the mission of the Health Policy and Research Division. Key responsibilities include:
Conducting high-quality, independent research on priority public health and health policy issues relevant to Cameroon and Africa.
Producing at least four (4) substantive outputs annually, including research papers, policy briefs, expert commentaries, or op-eds.
Providing technical guidance and thought leadership in health policy discussions, webinars, and other strategic engagements.
Offering mentorship to junior researchers and contributing to collaborative research efforts within the Division.
Supporting ongoing health policy programs, advocacy initiatives, and capacity-building activities led by the Nkafu Institute.
Upholding strict academic rigor, integrity, and timely delivery of assigned tasks.
Eligibility Criteria
Applicants must:
Be senior professionals with at least 7 years of relevant experience in public health, health policy, epidemiology, health economics, or related fields.
Hold an advanced degree (MPH, MSc, MD, PhD, DrPH, or equivalent); doctoral-level qualifications are strongly preferred.
Demonstrate a proven track record of peer-reviewed publications, policy analysis, or high-impact health research.
Exhibit strong analytical writing skills and the ability to translate complex evidence into actionable policy recommendations.
Show a deep understanding of African public health systems and policy environments.
Be able to commit to fulfilling part-time responsibilities over the fellowship year.
Benefits of the Fellowship
Recognition as a Non-Resident Fellow.
Opportunity to shape major policy conversations on health financing, governance, service delivery, and health system strengthening.
Visibility through publications, events, media engagements, and expert panels convened by the Institute.
Collaboration with a network of distinguished scholars, policymakers, and research partners across Africa and globally.
Monthly stipend to support fellowship activities.
Flexible, part-time engagement that allows Fellows to remain in their current roles.
Application Procedure and Requirements
Note
: Applications shall
ONLY
be accepted through the
online application portal
: we shall
NOT
accept applications sent by email.
Kindly click on the link and fill out the application form.
Applicants must submit:
Cover Letter outlining research interests, experience, and motivation.
Curriculum Vitae including publications and relevant accomplishments.
One Writing Sample (published or unpublished) demonstrating analytical and policy-relevant expertise.
Two Professional References, with full contact information.
Selection Process
Applications will be evaluated by a panel of senior Nkafu researchers. Selection will be based on professional experience, research excellence, policy relevance, and alignment with Nkafu’s mission. Shortlisted candidates may be invited for a virtual conversation. Finalists will receive a formal appointment letter outlining fellowship expectations, stipend terms, and renewal conditions.
Industries: Think Tanks, Civic and Social Organizations, and Research Services

Title: Call for Applications: Supply Chain & Pharmaceutical System Strengthening Experts
Description:
Management Sciences for Health (MSH) is a global health nonprofit that makes foundational changes to health systems to protect people from diseases and improve their health. MSH collaborates with local partners, from the Ministry of Health to the community, to strengthen and complement existing health systems. Since 1971, MSH has worked in more than 150 countries to help ensure sustainable, resilient, and equitable access to quality health care around the globe.
Apply to Be a Consultant
MSH invites qualified, individual consultants to express their interest in joining the MSH Consultant Roster for potential future collaborations in the global health sector. We encourage professionals with diverse skills and experiences to express their interest in joining the roster by submitting an application.
Location
Consultants can be remote or on-site as required by MSH.
Instructions for applying
Fill out the online application form and attach your latest CV and a cover letter.
Applicants must indicate their skills by selecting them from the drop-down list.
Please note that submission of an application does not guarantee automatic selection for the roster. MSH will contact candidates as needed.
Qualifications
Required Skills
Applicants that wish to apply for the Supply Chain & Pharmaceutical System Strengthening roster should possess the following skills/experiences:
Supply Chain Management
Pharmaceutical System Strengthening
Supply chain planning
Supply chain systems
Logistics Management Information Systems
Track and trace
CO2 emission reduction
Stakeholder Management & Governance
Performance & Reporting
MSH is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category under applicable federal, state, and local laws. MSH complies with Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act, Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Readjustment Assistance Act, as amended, and all related applicable regulations.

职位介绍 岗位职责： 1.负责按照生产计划，操作数控机床完成零部件加工等生产工作任务； 2.负责编制或协助相关部门编制加工程序，生产过程中不断优化程序或提出优化程序的建议； 3.加工前准备工具、辅具、量具等，根据生产工艺要求进行刀具修磨。 4.加工前了解掌握工艺要求，按照技术质量标准要求保证产品质量； 5.存在上道加工工序的，注意对上道工序进行质量检查； 6.操作中严格按照加工程序和工艺参数执行，进行首件检查及自检； 7.按规定需要填写追溯卡的，填制追溯卡。 8.负责保持安全文明生产，按照规定穿戴劳动保护用品； 9.负责进行生产现场的定置管理和5S管理。 10.负责按照规定对所负责设备进行日常清洁和维护保养； 11.生产加工前进行设备状态检查； 12.所用设备发生故障时，及时上报并配合维修。 职位要求： 1.大专及以上学历 2.专业要求为数控加工、数控编程、自动化等专业 3.两年及以上相关工作经验 4.熟练掌握数控加工基础知识，掌握数控机床安全操作规程，了解基本的编程知识 5.具有一定的编程能力、设备故障分析能力 6.数控加工技能鉴定等级证书或公司下发的上岗证 其他信息 行业要求：全部行业
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

聊一聊
职位介绍 岗位职责： 1.负责按照生产计划，操作数控机床完成零部件加工等生产工作任务； 2.负责编制或协助相关部门编制加工程序，生产过程中不断优化程序或提出优化程序的建议； 3.加工前准备工具、辅具、量具等，根据生产工艺要求进行刀具修磨。 4.加工前了解掌握工艺要求，按照技术质量标准要求保证产品质量； 5.操作中严格按照加工程序和工艺参数执行，进行首件检查及自检； 6.负责保持安全文明生产，按照规定穿戴劳动保护用品； 7.负责进行生产现场的定置管理和5S管理。 8.负责按照规定对所负责设备进行日常清洁和维护保养； 9.生产加工前进行设备状态检查； 10.所用设备发生故障时，及时上报并配合维修。 11.需操作水刀、折弯、锯床等设备。 职位要求： 1.大专及以上学历 2.专业要求为数控加工、数控编程、自动化等专业 3.三年及以上相关工作经验 4.熟练掌握数控加工基础知识，掌握数控机床安全操作规程，了解基本的编程知识 5.具有一定的编程能力、设备故障分析能力 6.数控加工技能鉴定等级证书 其他信息 行业要求：全部行业
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。

d. 以招聘名义牟取不正当利益；

Title: Part Time Chef De Partie / Breakfast Chef
Description:
Post author:pershorepatty
Job Title:
Chef De Partie / Breakfast Chef
Hours:
Part-Time (12-30 hours per week)
Pay:
£12-14 per hour
Location:
The Grovewood at The Malvern, Grovewood Road, Malvern, Worcestershire
How to apply:
Apply through Indeed.
Ref:
Please quote ‘Pershore Patty Job Board’ when applying directly.
Job description:
We are seeking a Part Time Breakfast Chef to join our team on the weekends at the hotel in preparing and delivering high-quality breakfast meals. Also working a few shifts throughout the week on the main line. The ideal candidate will have experience in meal preparation, particularly in a hotel or restaurant setting.
Duties
Prepare and cook breakfast items according to the menu specifications
Ensure all food is prepared and served in compliance with food safety standards
Assist in maintaining cleanliness and organisation of the kitchen area
Help with stock control and ordering supplies and deliveries as needed
Create afternoon teas and pod packages for the spa.
Cover holidays of other staff members.
Qualifications
Previous experience in a culinary role, preferably within a hotel or restaurant environment
Knowledge of food safety practices and procedures
Ability to work individually on breakfast service
Strong communication skills to work effectively in a team environment
Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced kitchen setting
Familiarity with breakfast food preparation techniques and presentation
Join our team as a Part Time Breakfast Chef to showcase your culinary skills and contribute to providing an exceptional breakfast experience for our guests.
Additional Pay
Tips
Benefits
Company events
Company pension
Discounted or free food
Employee discount
Free parking
Gym membership
On-site gym
On-site parking
Store discount
Schedule
Every weekend
Holidays
Monday to Friday
Overtime
Experience
Chef: 3 years (required)
Breakfast service: 2 years (required)
Licence/Certification
Driving Licence (preferred)

职位介绍 岗位职责： 1、负责使用数控机床进行零件的加工工作； 2、能够根据提供的图纸进行准确的加工操作，并确保产品质量符合标准； 3、参与生产过程中的质量控制，及时反馈生产过程中遇到的问题； 4、完成上级领导安排的其他相关工作任务。 岗位要求： 1、大专及以上学历，专业不限，机械、机电、数控等相关专业优先； 2、具有2年以上的车工工作经验，熟悉数控机床的操作； 3、能独立看懂机械图纸，具备一定的机械基础知识； 4、身体健康，年龄在35岁以下； 5、具备良好的团队合作精神，服从管理，积极主动； 6、具备较强的学习能力和适应能力，愿意接受技能培训以提升个人技能。 其他信息 行业要求：全部行业
公司简介
万丰奥特控股集团（以下简称“万丰集团”）创立于1994年，是一家“大交通”领域以先进制造业为核心的国际化企业。一直以来，万丰集团秉持“实业报国、产业强国”的责任使命，遵循“永恒提升价值、不断奉献社会”的理想信念，产业涉足汽车部件、航空工业、智能装备、金融投资等领域，致力于“营造国际品牌、构筑百年企业”。 历经20多年的发展，万丰集团资产超300亿元、员工1.5万人以上，位列中国民营企业500*强、中国汽车工业30强、浙江省100强，已形成轻量化应用汽车部件和通用飞机制造“双引擎”驱动的发展格局，打造全球汽车金属部件轻量化推动者和领*导者、通用飞机创新制造企业的全球领跑者。其中：轻量化铝轮、新材料镁合金产业实现细分市场全球；新工艺涂覆、智能装备工业机器人产业实现细分市场国内；战略性新兴产业通航产业成为全国民企集飞机制造、机场建设、航校培训、通航运营、低空保障、航空俱乐部等于一体全产业链的样板，占地5.5平方公里的万丰航空小镇已列入国家通用航空综合示范区、国家空中游览基地、国家飞行营地、浙江省特色小镇，所产拥有全部知识产权的钻石通航飞机进入世界品牌前三强。借助上市公司平台，万丰集团朝着行业领*先、向千亿目标迈进，从经营国际化向资本、人才、科技、品牌国际化转型升级。 步入新发展阶段，贯彻新发展理念，融入新发展格局，万丰集团将牢牢抓住国家大力发展战略性新兴产业的历史机遇，践行《中国制造2025》战略和“国际国内双循环”新发展格局，专注实体经济，弘扬工匠精神，以数字经济为牵引，以实业经营为基础，不断扩大产业规模，带动周边群体共享发展，实现“百强百誉百年万丰”的战略目标，争当浙江省高质量发展共同富裕标杆企业，为振兴地方经济、推动行业进步、促进社会发展贡献万丰更多的智慧和力量。
查看全部

c. 强迫您入股或者向您集资；
d. 以招聘名义牟取不正当利益；
e. 发布虚假招聘广告信息；
f. 工作时长违反劳动法规定；
g. 存在其他损害您的合法权益的行为。

Title: Call for Applications: Supply Chain & Pharmaceutical System Strengthening Experts
Description:
Management Sciences for Health (MSH) is a global health nonprofit that makes foundational changes to health systems to protect people from diseases and improve their health. MSH collaborates with local partners, from the Ministry of Health to the community, to strengthen and complement existing health systems. Since 1971, MSH has worked in more than 150 countries to help ensure sustainable, resilient, and equitable access to quality health care around the globe.
Apply to Be a Consultant
MSH invites qualified, individual consultants to express their interest in joining the MSH Consultant Roster for potential future collaborations in the global health sector. We encourage professionals with diverse skills and experiences to express their interest in joining the roster by submitting an application.
Location
Consultants can be remote or on-site as required by MSH.
Instructions for applying
Fill out the online application form and attach your latest CV and a cover letter.
Applicants must indicate their skills by selecting them from the drop-down list.
Please note that submission of an application does not guarantee automatic selection for the roster. MSH will contact candidates as needed.
Qualifications
Required Skills
Applicants that wish to apply for the Supply Chain & Pharmaceutical System Strengthening roster should possess the following skills/experiences:
Supply Chain Management
Pharmaceutical System Strengthening
Supply chain planning
Supply chain systems
Logistics Management Information Systems
Track and trace
CO2 emission reduction
Stakeholder Management & Governance
Performance & Reporting
MSH is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected category under applicable federal, state, and local laws.
